catalyst.context: A ternary Z-scheme Ag-Cu 2 O/TiO 2 catalyst was prepared by one-step chemical reduction method which was applied in photocatalytic CO 2 reduction with water vapor under simulated sunlight in a recirculation reactor.The structure, morphology, photo absorption capacity and optoelectronic properties of the obtained samples were characterized by XRD, TEM, XPS, UV-vis DRS and Photoelectrochemical measurements.The photocatalytic activity tests showed that 0.5Ag-0.5Cu 2 O/TiO 2 exhibited the highest production rate of CO (13.19 mol/g/h) and CH 4 (1.74 mol/g/h) under simulated sunlight when compared to P25, 1Cu 2 O/TiO 2 and 1Ag/TiO 2 .Mechanism studies by means of EPR technology testified that the improvement of photocatalytic performance was mainly due to the formation of Z-scheme heterojunctions between P25 and Cu 2 O, which facilitated the separation of photogenerated charges.The incorporation of Ag nanoparticles further enhanced the transfer of photogenerated carriers and the absorption of visible light, thus preventing the selfreduction of Cu 2 O and improving the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction performance.

For comparison, Cu 2 O/TiO 2 with 1 Cu (mol) and Ag/TiO 2 with 1 Ag (mol) were also synthesized by the same method as above, which were labeled as 1Cu 2 O/TiO 2 and 1Ag/TiO 2 . The CO 2 photoreduction with H 2 O vapor was carried out in a circulation system with a total volume 300 m.50 mg photocatalyst was coated on the surface of ceramic substrate, and the ceramic substrate was placed vertically in the center of quartz tube reactor.The 300 W xenon lamp (PLS-SXE 300 C xenon lamp) equipped with an AM 1.5 G filter was used as simulated sunlight source.Water was brought into reactor by bubbling with CO 2 gas.Prior to light irradiation, the reactor was rinsed with CO 2 (30 mL/min) for 1 h at 200 C to remove the air in the reactor and the organic substances adsorbed on the catalyst surface.After that, the gas circuit was switched to circulation system, and then peristaltic pump and Xe arc lamp were turned on.After reaction for 2 h, 0.1 mL of gas was extracted with a syringe from the reactor and analyzed by an gas chromatography using a thermal conductivity detector. catalyst.context: In summary, Ag-Cu 2 O/TiO 2 with Z-scheme heterojunctions was successfully constructed by one-step reduction method.The characterization of UV-vis DRS, PL and photocurrent response indicate that the absorption performance and photogenerated carrier separation efficiency can be effectively enhanced by incorporation of Ag and Cu 2 O.In the fabricated photocatalysts, only 0.5Ag-0.5Cu 2 O/ TiO 2 catalyst can catalyze the reduction of CO 2 to CH 4 and had much higher activity than pure P25, 1Cu 2 O/TiO 2 and 1Ag/TiO 2 for CO 2 reduction to CO.It has been revealed that the Z-scheme heterojunctions facilitate the charge separation between P25 and Cu 2 O, and Ag as the co-catalyst to trap the electrons of Cu 2 O, which further promoted the transfer of photogenerated carriers and inhibits the selfphotoreduction of Cu 2 O. Furthermore, Ag nanoparticles can also improve the absorption of visible light due to the surface plasmon resonance effect.By this way, the photocatalytic activity of 0.5Ag-0.5Cu 2 O/TiO 2 can be significantly enhanced. co-catalyst.context: A ternary Z-scheme Ag-Cu 2 O/TiO 2 catalyst was prepared by one-step chemical reduction method which was applied in photocatalytic CO 2 reduction with water vapor under simulated sunlight in a recirculation reactor.The structure, morphology, photo absorption capacity and optoelectronic properties of the obtained samples were characterized by XRD, TEM, XPS, UV-vis DRS and Photoelectrochemical measurements.The photocatalytic activity tests showed that 0.5Ag-0.5Cu 2 O/TiO 2 exhibited the highest production rate of CO (13.19 mol/g/h) and CH 4 (1.74 mol/g/h) under simulated sunlight when compared to P25, 1Cu 2 O/TiO 2 and 1Ag/TiO 2 .Mechanism studies by means of EPR technology testified that the improvement of photocatalytic performance was mainly due to the formation of Z-scheme heterojunctions between P25 and Cu 2 O, which facilitated the separation of photogenerated charges.The incorporation of Ag nanoparticles further enhanced the transfer of photogenerated carriers and the absorption of visible light, thus preventing the selfreduction of Cu 2 O and improving the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction performance.
